text.text_translated:
A species is a type of animal. Breeding programmes are special plans to help animals have babies.

Zoos have a very important job today. They help international breeding programmes. These plans help endangered species. Endangered means a type of animal that is in danger.

In the wild, these animals have problems. It is hard for them to find a partner. Poachers can kill them. Poachers are people who kill animals illegally. The animals can also lose their habitat. A habitat is an animal's natural home. And other animals can kill them.

A good zoo gives these animals a safe place. They can live and have babies in the zoo.

There is another problem for wild animals. Sometimes there are not many animals of one type. This is a big danger. When animals in a group are a little different from each other, the group is stronger. This is called genetic diversity. If animals are too similar, the group is weak.

Breeding programmes are a safeguard. A safeguard is something that protects. Animals from zoos can go back to the wild. They can have babies with the wild animals. This increases the genetic diversity. This makes the group of animals stronger. This helps the species to stay alive.

best_attempt.text_translated:
A species is a type of animal. Some species are in danger.
Breeding programmes are special plans. Countries work together on them. The plans help animals have babies.

Zoos have a very important job today. They help with international breeding programmes. This is for species that are in danger.

In nature, these animals have problems. It is hard for them to find a partner and have babies. People might catch and kill them. They can lose their homes. And other animals can kill them.

A good zoo gives these animals a safe place. They can live and have babies in the zoo.

There is another problem. Sometimes there are not many animals of one species. It is not good if all the animals are from the same family. This is not healthy for the species.

Breeding programmes protect the future of these animals. Animals from zoos can go back to live in nature. They bring new animals to a group. Then, the animals in the group are not all the same. This helps the species to be strong and healthy.
